level.text: 499.1 The terms “digital dispatch,” “digital dispatch service or DDS,”“dispatch,” and “telephone dispatch” shall have the meanings ascribedn Chapter 16 of this title.
499.2 When used in this chapter, the following words and phrases shall have theeanings ascribed:
“Affiliated” – common ownership.

“Cash payment” – a payment to the operator by the passenger inside theehicle using cash. A cash payment is a form of in-vehicle payment.

A cashless payment is not a “digital payment,” as such terms defined in this section.

“Gratuity” – a voluntary payment by the passenger after service isendered, which, if made, shall be included as part of the total charge under §01.9, in the amount determined only by the passenger.
“Group Riding” – a group of two (2) or more passengers composed prioro the booking by dispatch or street hail and whose trip has a common point ofrigin, and different or common destinations.
“Implementation date” – the date for implementation of MTS units in allaxicabs, as provided in § 603.2.
“Independent taxicab” – a taxicab operated by an individual owner.

“Independently Operated Taxicab” – a taxicab operated by an individualwner that is not part of a fleet, company, or association and that does notperate under the name, logo, or insignia of any fleet, company, or association.

“In-Vehicle Payment” – a payment made to the operator by the passengernside the vehicle, consisting only of a cash payment or a cashless payment.
“License” shall have the meaning ascribed to it in the D.C. Administrativerocedure Act, D.C. Official Code § 2-502.
“License Act” – D.C. Official Code § 47-2829.
“Limousine” shall have the meaning ascribed to it by § 1299.1.

“Loitering” – waiting around or in front of a hotel, theater, publicuilding, or place of public gathering or in the vicinity of a taxicab orimousine stand that is occupied to full capacity; stopping in such locations,xcept to take on or discharge a passenger; or unnecessarily slow driving inront of a hotel, theater, public building, or place of public gathering or inhe vicinity of a taxicab or limousine stand that is occupied to full capacity.
“Modern taximeter system” or “MTS” – a technology solution thatombines taximeter equipment and PSP service and support in the manner requiredy this chapter and § 603.
“MTS unit” – the MTS equipment installed in a particular vehicle.
“Notice” – notice of transfer under § 507.
“Office” – Office of Taxicabs.

“Office order” – an administrative issuance by the Office to a classf persons or vehicles regulated by a provision of this title or otherpplicable law that: adopts a form; issues a guideline or protocol applicableo persons other than employees of the Office; provides guidance concerning arovision of this title; or takes any action that the Office deems necessary forurposes of administration, enforcement, or compliance.
“Operator” – a person who operates a public vehicle-for-hire.

“Owner” – a person, corporation, partnership, or association thatolds the legal title to a public vehicle-for-hire, the registration of which isequired in the District of Columbia. If the title of a public vehicle-for-hires subject to a lien, a mortgagor may also be considered an owner.

“Payment card” – any major credit or debit card including Visa,asterCard, American Express, and Discover.

“Payment information on file” – any payment card, direct debit, orre-paid account that allows a person authorized to process a recurring payment,o process such payment without requiring the person authorizing the payment toresent the original payment information.

Officialode § 47-2829, including taxicabs, limousines, and sedans.

“Shared Riding” – a group of two (2) or more passengers, arranged by atarter at Union Station, Verizon Center, or Nationals Park, or other locationsesignated by an administrative order of the Office, that has common orifferent destinations.

“Surcharge Bond” – a security bond of fifty-thousand dollars ($50,000)ayable to the D.C. Treasurer for the purpose of securing a person’s paymentf a passenger surcharge to the District, which remains effective throughout theeriod when such person has operating authority under this title and for one (1)ear thereafter.

“Taxicab” – a public vehicle-for-hire that operates pursuant tohapter 6 and other applicable provisions of this title, having a seatingapacity for eight (8) or fewer passengers, exclusive of the driver, andperated or offered as a vehicle for passenger transportation for hire.
“Taxicab Commission Information System” or “TCIS” – thenformation system operated by the Office.
“Taxicab company” – a taxicab company that operates pursuant Chapter 5nd other applicable provisions of this title.
“Taximeter fare” – the fare established by § 801.7.

“Washington Metropolitan Area” – the area encompassed by the District;ontgomery County, Prince Georges County, and Frederick County in Maryland;rlington County, Fairfax County, Loudon County, and Prince William County andhe cities of Alexandria, Fairfax, Falls Church, Manassas, and Manassas Park inirginia.
